solution_line_template: If the house has twice the number of large ones as medium ones then the house has {large_to_medium_ratio}*{num_medium} = <<{large_to_medium_ratio}*{num_medium}={num_large}>>{num_large} large ceiling lights

Similarly, if it has {small_more_than_medium} more small ones than the {num_medium} medium ones then it has {small_more_than_medium}+{num_medium} = <<{small_more_than_medium}+{num_medium}={num_small}>>{num_small} small ceiling lights
If one small ceiling light requires {bulbs_per_small} bulb then {num_small} small ones will require {bulbs_per_small}*{num_small} = <<{bulbs_per_small}*{num_small}={bulbs_small}>>{bulbs_small} bulbs

If one medium ceiling light requires {bulbs_per_medium} bulbs then {num_medium} medium ones will require {bulbs_per_medium}*{num_medium} = <<{bulbs_per_medium}*{num_medium}={bulbs_medium}>>{bulbs_medium} bulbs

If one large ceiling light requires {bulbs_per_large} bulbs then {num_large} medium ones will require {bulbs_per_large}*{num_large} = <<{bulbs_per_large}*{num_large}={bulbs_large}>>{bulbs_large} bulbs

Therefore the house will require {bulbs_small} bulbs for the small ones + {bulbs_medium} bulbs for the medium ones + {bulbs_large} bulbs for the large ones, for a total of {bulbs_small}+{bulbs_medium}+{bulbs_large}=<<{bulbs_small}+{bulbs_medium}+{bulbs_large}={total_bulbs}>>{total_bulbs}
